cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi (200 km) E of Melbourne, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast parallel to the Florida–Georgia coast, then accelerating northeastward and passing well east of Georgia before approaching the Outer Banks of North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Cape Hatteras, NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coasts of east-central Florida northward to the southeast and mid-Atlantic states, mainly within 100–150 mi of the shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 20-30 mph with occasional gusts to gale force possible Sunday afternoon as ARTHUR passes ~100 mi east of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft above normal tide levels possible; elevated surf.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light rain bands, generally ≤1 inch total.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents that can hamper pilot transfers and small-craft operations.
